es.unican.ctr.marte2mast.files
Class HelperFunctions

java.lang.Object
  es.unican.ctr.marte2mast.files.HelperFunctions

public class HelperFunctions
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains a series of helper functions for things like extracting properties from UML stereotypes, parsing VSL formatted strings, copying files...

getAppliedStereotype

public static org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Stereotype getAppliedStereotype(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element theElement,
                                                                   java.lang.String stereotypeName)
Checks if a UML element has a stereotype with the provided name and returns it.

Parameters:
theElement - UML element with the applied stereotype
stereotypeName - the name of the stereotype we want
Returns:
the Stereotype with the provided name if it exists, or null if it doesn't

getStereotypeProperty

public static java.lang.Object getStereotypeProperty(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element theElement,
                                                     java.lang.String stereotypeName,
                                                     java.lang.String propertyName)
Checks if a UML element has a stereotype with the provided name and returns the value of given property.

Parameters:
theElement - UML element with the applied stereotype
stereotypeName - the name of the stereotype we want
propertyName - the name of the property whose value we want
Returns:
the the value of the property if it exists, or null if it doesn't

setStereotypeProperty

public static void setStereotypeProperty(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element theElement,
                                         java.lang.String stereotypeName,
                                         java.lang.String propertyName,
                                         java.lang.String theValue,
                                         boolean singleValueProperty,
                                         boolean overwrite)
Work In Progress: Checks if a UML element has a stereotype with the provided name and changes the value of given property to the provided one.

Parameters:
theElement - UML element with the applied stereotype
stereotypeName - the name of the stereotype
propertyName - the name of the property whose value we want to change
singleValueProperty - true if property only allows one value: [0..1]
overwrite - delete previous content?
theValue - new value for the property

Parameters:

Returns:

getStereotypeEnumLiteralName

public static java.lang.Object getStereotypeEnumLiteralName(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element theElement,
                                                            java.lang.String stereotype,
                                                            java.lang.String propertyName)
Returns the name of a stereotype's enumeration literal's value. This method is no longer used or updated.

Parameters:
theElement - UML element with the applied stereotype
stereotype - the name of the stereotype we want
propertyName - the name of the property whose value we want
Returns:
the name of the enumeration literal

getStereotypeReference

public static java.lang.Object getStereotypeReference(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element theElement,
                                                      java.lang.String stereotypeName,
                                                      java.lang.String propertyName)
Extract the ecore class' implementation (I think that's what it is :)) referenced by the stereotype's property. For example, useful when getStereotypeProperty returns something like: GRM.Scheduler (eClass: org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.EClassImpl@13fed2e (name: Scheduler)[...]

Parameters:
theElement - UML element with the applied stereotype
stereotypeName - the name of the stereotype we want
propertyName - the name of the property whose value we want
Returns:
the referenced object pointed by the stereotype property

getStereotypeReferenceName

public static java.lang.Object getStereotypeReferenceName(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element theElement,
                                                          java.lang.String stereotypeName,
                                                          java.lang.String propertyName)
Same as getStereotypeReference but returning just the name of the referenced element

Parameters:
theElement - UML element with the applied stereotype
stereotypeName - the name of the stereotype we want
propertyName - the name of the property whose value we want
Returns:
the referenced object's name

getStereotypeReferenceProperty

public static java.lang.Object getStereotypeReferenceProperty(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element theElement,
                                                              java.lang.String stereotypeName,
                                                              java.lang.String propertyName,
                                                              java.lang.String stereotypeNameRef,
                                                              java.lang.String propertyNameRef)
Uses getStereotypeReference and getStereotypeProperty to return the value of a stereotype's property from an element referenced in another element's stereotype's property.

Parameters:
theElement - UML element with the applied stereotype
stereotypeName - the name of the stereotype we want
propertyName - the name of the property containing the referenced element
propertyNameRef - the name of the referenced element's property whose value we want
Returns:
the the value of the property if it exists, or null if it doesn't

getStereotypeRefListNames

public static java.lang.Object getStereotypeRefListNames(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element theElement,
                                                         java.lang.String stereotypeName,
                                                         java.lang.String propertyName)
Same case as with getStereotypeReferenceName BUT used when the stereotype stores a list of "references" instead of just one.

Parameters:
theElement - UML element with the applied stereotype
stereotypeName - the name of the stereotype we want
propertyName - the name of the property whose value we want
Returns:
the referenced object's name list

getSubUsage

public static java.util.List<org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Operation> getSubUsage(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element theElement,
                                                                         java.lang.String stereotypeName,
                                                                         java.lang.String propertyName)
Returns a list containing the operations included in the given property's value, the value of the propertyName parameter should always be "subUsage" in this context but it's left as user defined to allow the method to be used in other cases.

Parameters:
theElement - UML element with the applied stereotype
stereotypeName - the name of the stereotype we want, usually "SaStep"
propertyName - the name of the property whose value we want, should be "subUsage" in this context.
Returns:
a list of operations

getElementLongName

public static java.lang.String getElementLongName(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element theElement)
Given a UML element it returns a name composed of the last 2 element of its qualified name: element__fatherelement (if it has no father element it simply returns the 'normal' name)

Returns:
the elements long name

getElementWithLongName

public static org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element getElementWithLongName(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element theElement,
                                                                  java.lang.String elementLongName)
Returns the element with the given long name (case insensitive) if it finds it among the children of the element or itself.

See also: getElementLongName.

Parameters:
theElement - root element to check
elementLongName - the name of the element we are looking for
Returns:
the element with the given name if one was , null if not

parseGetFirstValidVSL

public static java.lang.String parseGetFirstValidVSL(java.lang.String inputText)
Some properties can store multiple values. This method returns the fist valid one, in our case: the one with no statQ=calc

Parameters:
inputText - text to check
Returns:
the first valid VSL expression

parseIntegerInterval

public static java.lang.Object parseIntegerInterval(java.lang.String inputText,
                                                    java.lang.String marOrMin)
VSL parsing: receives an IntegerInterval and returns the max or min value

i.e. [0..34[

Parameters:
inputText - VSL formatted input string
marOrMin - "min" or "max"
Returns:
the max or min value

public static java.lang.String parse_Integer(java.lang.String propertiesText,
                                             java.lang.String propertyName)
VSL parsing: utility function used by parse_NFPInteger

i.e. [0..34[

Parameters:
propertiesText - VSL formatted input string
propertyName - "value", "source", "statQ" ...
Returns:
the parsed value of the property

parseNFP_Integer

public static java.lang.String parseNFP_Integer(java.lang.String inputText,
                                                java.lang.String propertyName)
VSL parsing: receives an NFP_Integer value and parses the selected property

i.e. (value=6)

Parameters:
inputText - VSL formatted input string
propertyName - property whose value we want
Returns:
the parsed value of the property

parseNFP_Integer

public static java.lang.String parseNFP_Integer(java.lang.String inputText,
                                                java.lang.String propertyName,
                                                java.lang.String statQ)
VSL parsing: overloaded version of parseNFP_Integer used specifically for a required statQ

example: (value=2,statQ=min),(value=3,statQ=max)

Parameters:
inputText - VSL formatted input string
propertyName - property whose value we want
statQ - required statQ of the property
Returns:
the parsed value of the property

i.e. (value=0.6)

Parameters:

propertyName - property whose value we want
Returns:
the parsed value of the property

i.e. (value=0.6,unit=ms)

getArrivalPatternType

public static java.lang.String getArrivalPatternType(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element theElement)
Given a 'GaWorkloadEvent' stereotyped element, it returns the 'pattern' data (MARTE).

i.e. periodic(period=(value=0.6,unit=ms))

Returns:
the 'pattern' data, or null if no data was found

getPacketOverhead

public static java.lang.Object getPacketOverhead(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element theElement)
Calculates the packet overhead (MAST) given the 'blockT' and 'packetT' (MARTE).

Parameters:
theElement - 'SaCommHost' stereotyped UML element
Returns:
the packet overhead (worst/avg/best) text in MAST format

modifyAndSafeAuxFiles

public static boolean modifyAndSafeAuxFiles(java.lang.String fileBasePath,
                                            java.lang.String oldModelName,
                                            java.lang.String newModelName,
                                            java.lang.String directoryPath,
                                            boolean overwrite)
Used to copy the original .di and .notation files from the input model to the target folder AND modify them to match the new model name

Parameters:
fileBasePath - path to the original model file, without the ".uml" extension
oldModelName - original name of the model
newModelName - new name of the model
directoryPath - path of the target folder (where the files will be copied to)
overwrite - not used yet
Returns:
true if successful, false if not

copyFile2Directory

public static boolean copyFile2Directory(java.lang.String filePath,
                                         java.lang.String directoryPath,
                                         boolean overwrite)
Copies a file to a given folder

Parameters:
filePath - path to the input file
directoryPath - path to the destination's folder
overwrite - if the output file already exists: overwrite it?
Returns:
true if successful, false if not
